page.title: 02Cooling Towers
page.content: Prior to 1980 uranium enrichment at B.N.F.L. was at the diffusion plant with its 11 distinctive cooling towers Then the new E21 Centrifuge Plant came into operation with the same output but 90% less energy consumption.In 1983 E22 with double its output began production & its twin E23 is under construction.Together they are much smaller than the old plant,are easily extended & require no large cooling towers.The old towers are being dismantled piecemeal as explosives would affect the sensitive centrifuge plant.The centrifuges are made and assembled on site.In 1986 a new plant will open making fuel for nuclear submarines.The uranium hexafluoride used in the enrichment process is brought by road from BNFL's Springfields Plant.Capenhurst currently employs 2,200 people.
